sentence.Network_en: He seems hell-bent on drinking himself to death.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一个劲地喝酒，似乎命都不要了。

sentence.Network_en: He accused Ford of being hell-bent on achieving its cuts by whatever means.
sentence.Network_cn: 他指责福特公司不择手段一心要实现削减。

sentence.Network_en: He was hell - bent on going in spite of the heavy rain.
sentence.Network_cn: 尽管下着大雨,他还是坚决要出去.

entry.def: If you say that someone is hell-bent on doing something, you are emphasizing that they are determined to do it, even if this causes problems or difficulties for other people.

example.ex: He accused Ford of being hell-bent on achieving its cuts by whatever means.
example.tran: 他指责福特公司不择手段一心要实现削减。

example.ex: ...a side hell-bent on a place in the Premier League.
example.tran: 决意打入英超联赛的球队
